storyInfo: An eccentric painter living in a remote town gets a surprise visit.

attributes.content: I'm sorry, we're not open yet. Please come back in the afternoon.
attributes.name: Art Shop Owner

attributes.content: Sorry about the timing. I'm not here to buy art; I just have some questions.
attributes.name: Strange Outsider

attributes.content: For your trouble.
attributes.name: Strange Outsider

attributes.content: (Slips a gold coin through the crack in the door)
attributes.name: Strange Outsider

attributes.content: This is...
attributes.name: Art Shop Owner

attributes.content: Consider it a token of appreciation. And there's more where that came from, if you've got the information I need.
attributes.name: Strange Outsider

attributes.content: A pleasure to meet you in the flesh, sir.
attributes.name: Strange Outsider

attributes.content: Er, ahem... what can I help you with?
attributes.name: Art Shop Owner

attributes.content: Last month, a painting that is very dear to me suffered moisture damage thanks to improper storage.
attributes.name: Strange Outsider

attributes.content: I've heard that a very skilled restoration painter lives here, so I thought I would try my luck.
attributes.name: Strange Outsider

attributes.content: Oh... that could be tricky. She's not easy to find.
attributes.name: Art Shop Owner

attributes.content: Does she live outside town? I've got more gold coins.
attributes.name: Strange Outsider

attributes.content: (Takes out a gold coins from his sleeves)
attributes.name: Strange Outsider

attributes.content: No, she's in town, but she's a little eccentric. We keep our distance from her, when we can help it.
attributes.name: Art Shop Owner

attributes.content: She's got a temper? Violent type? Or more of an arrogant artist?
attributes.name: Strange Outsider

attributes.content: Well... you might say she's got a sunny disposition.
attributes.name: Art Shop Owner

attributes.content: Oh?
attributes.name: Strange Outsider

attributes.content: It's not so bad when she's at home painting, other than the strange noises, from time to time. When she's sketching outside, though... everyone stays as far away as they can. Don't want to get press ganged into modeling for her.
attributes.name: Art Shop Owner

attributes.content: There's no getting away once she sets her eyes on you. You have to sit there and wait for her to finish, no matter what else you might have to do.
attributes.name: Art Shop Owner

attributes.content: And, as you know, paintings aren't the quickest thing to get done... poof, there goes your whole day.
attributes.name: Art Shop Owner

attributes.content: Why don't you just say no?
attributes.name: Strange Outsider

attributes.content: Yeah... why not just turn her down? Seems easy enough.
attributes.name: Art Shop Owner

attributes.content: (Mutters to himself with a blank expression)
attributes.name: Art Shop Owner

attributes.content: Sir? Are you okay?
attributes.name: Strange Outsider

attributes.content: I-I'm fine. I'm trying to think back to what she said to me, but I just can't remember a thing.
attributes.name: Art Shop Owner

attributes.content: That's a little weird... heh.
attributes.name: Strange Outsider

attributes.content: Anyway, it doesn't matter. She's a little loopy, you know. Says lots of weird things.
attributes.name: Art Shop Owner

attributes.content: Don't let the things she says get to you. I'm sure she doesn't mean any harm by them.
attributes.name: Art Shop Owner

attributes.content: Heh... didn't think you'd turn around and start defending her.
attributes.name: Strange Outsider

attributes.content: She's a little off-kilter, sure, but she's never hurt anybody. Plus...
attributes.name: Art Shop Owner

attributes.content: Half of what I sell here is her work. Her stuff is popular.
attributes.name: Art Shop Owner

attributes.content: A hardworking painter! Now I'm even more curious.
attributes.name: Strange Outsider

attributes.content: Well, sir, if you insist, I can take you to her.
attributes.name: Art Shop Owner

attributes.content: This is where she lives. I'll be on my way now.
attributes.name: Art Shop Owner

attributes.content: You're not coming in with me?
attributes.name: Strange Outsider

attributes.content: Er... well, I have a thing.
attributes.name: Art Shop Owner

attributes.content: Okay, then. Thanks.
attributes.name: Strange Outsider

attributes.content: (Takes out a few gold coins from his sleeves)
attributes.name: Strange Outsider

attributes.content: For your trouble.
attributes.name: Strange Outsider

attributes.content: Oh, thank you so much! That's kind of you. Please feel free to come by my shop if there's anything else I can help with.
attributes.name: Art Shop Owner

attributes.content: Goodbye now.
attributes.name: Strange Outsider

attributes.content: Huh? Oh, alright, goodbye.
attributes.name: Art Shop Owner

attributes.content: What a nice little hideout.
attributes.name: Strange Outsider

attributes.content: It is almost noon, and the sun shines brightly outside.

Inside, however, all the doors and windows are tightly shut, with only a few rays of sunlight leaking through the cracks between the boards that have been nailed to the windows, preventing the room from being entirely engulfed in darkness.
The visitor hears the faint sound of scratching coming from the darkest corner.
He straightens his robe and approaches a massive canvas standing upright. A woman is using her brush to fill it with color.

attributes.name: Eccentric Artist
attributes.content: Should the brush be drier? But then the brush marks would be too distinct...

attributes.name: Eccentric Artist
attributes.content: No, that's not the color that I wanted.
attributes.joined: Should the brush be drier? But then the brush marks would be too distinct...No, that's not the color that I wanted.

attributes.content: How's that? Does that look better?
attributes.name: Eccentric Artist

attributes.content: The colors could run further down the canvas. I have to do it with a single stroke. No interruptions now... none whatsoever.
attributes.name: Eccentric Artist

attributes.content: It's been a while...
attributes.name: Strange Outsider

attributes.content: Oh, it's you. Have a seat.
attributes.name: Eccentric Artist

attributes.content: When was the last time you cleaned? You can't see anything in that mirror anymore.
attributes.name: Strange Outsider

attributes.content: Hah, are you belittling my humble abode, Father? You can't imagine the inspiration I find here.
attributes.name: Eccentric Artist

attributes.content: You haven't changed a bit. You don't care about anything but your art.
attributes.name: Priest

attributes.content: You've changed a lot. Your brow didn't furrow like that.
attributes.name: Eccentric Artist

attributes.content: Really...?
attributes.name: Priest

attributes.content: Something on your mind?
attributes.name: Eccentric Artist

attributes.content: Well, if you don't want to talk about it, I won't pry.
attributes.name: Eccentric Artist

attributes.content: The first time I saw you, you were absorbed in your painting, just like this.
attributes.name: Priest

attributes.content: The first time you saw me? When was that? It's been so long, I can't remember.
attributes.name: Eccentric Artist

attributes.content: I was hiding behind that boulder, that day you met the Herald for the first time.
attributes.name: Priest

attributes.content: So you were by the water... all I remember is the beauty the Herald showed me. I've never seen a creature so beautiful.
attributes.name: Eccentric Artist

attributes.content: The Herald must have felt your admiration, guiding you into we many after just one contact.
attributes.name: Priest

attributes.content: I've always been grateful.
attributes.name: Eccentric Artist

attributes.content: But you turned around, one step from the ocean.
attributes.name: Priest

attributes.content: I'm not making excuses.
attributes.name: Eccentric Artist

attributes.content: Did you abandon the many and turn against your kin just to finish this painting?
attributes.name: Priest

attributes.content: (Touches the canvas with a finger)
attributes.name: Priest

attributes.content: So beautiful, but burdened by so much sin.
attributes.name: Priest

attributes.content: I'm sorry.
attributes.name: Eccentric Artist

attributes.content: But your regret hasn't stopped your brush.
attributes.name: Priest

attributes.content: You were too stubborn, too short-sighted. You trapped yourself in the canvas and failed to see the distant future.
attributes.name: Priest

attributes.content: You didn't understand the many. You couldn't fit in with the many. You should have nourished the many if you could not be assimilated.
attributes.name: Priest

attributes.content: That should have been your end. I am regretful, but joyful. We will become one, sister.
attributes.name: Priest

attributes.content: (Sleeves quiver)
attributes.name: Priest

attributes.content: Would you put that away for now? I want to finish this before it's all over.
attributes.name: Eccentric Artist

attributes.content: (Straightens sleeves)
attributes.name: Priest

attributes.content: It took me a long time to get here. I can wait a little longer.
attributes.name: Priest

attributes.content: Good.
attributes.name: Eccentric Artist

attributes.content: And there's something I wanted to ask you before I end your life.
attributes.name: Priest

attributes.content: Go on. My brush won't stop, though.
attributes.name: Eccentric Artist

attributes.content: Why did you choose to leave us?
attributes.name: Priest

attributes.content: Life is eternal in we many. We are inextricably linked, sharing our joy, anger, sorrow, happiness.
attributes.name: Priest

attributes.content: That 'sharing' you're talking about is just about robbing me of all emotion, transforming me into a mouth for the will of the many.
attributes.name: Eccentric Artist

attributes.content: Your outbursts are meaningless. It will not soothe your anger, nor abate your sorrow. It will only make you wallow in boundless misery as you step ever closer to destruction.
attributes.name: Priest

attributes.content: We many have sealed away excess emotion. A constant state of heightened alertness is not conductive to the many's continued survival.
attributes.name: Priest

attributes.content: You should cast it away and embrace peace and tranquility with us, free from the trappings of your own emotion.
attributes.name: Priest

attributes.content: My cries of sorrow, anger and angst are the fertile soil of my art.
attributes.name: Eccentric Artist

attributes.content: I never joined you to get peace or tranquility.
attributes.name: Eccentric Artist

attributes.content: Then what did you want from us?
attributes.name: Priest

attributes.content: That's never changed, whether I chose to join or leave.
attributes.name: Eccentric Artist

attributes.content: I want beauty, eternal beauty, dwelling in all life.
attributes.name: Eccentric Artist

attributes.content: Didn't you find it?
attributes.name: Priest

attributes.content: A glimpse of the Herald's beauty was enough to change your life forever. Was that not enough?
attributes.name: Priest

attributes.content: The Herald left his seed in you, made you one of us, to partake in our beauty.
attributes.name: Priest

attributes.content: Yes, your bodies hold the ultimate beauty, beyond anything else.
attributes.name: Eccentric Artist

attributes.content: But have you ever noticed it, appreciated it?
attributes.name: Eccentric Artist

attributes.content: The choices you make guide you to eternal art, but you can't even be moved by art.
attributes.name: Eccentric Artist

attributes.content: You faced survival and evolution, and your answer was to abandon the concept of beauty.
attributes.name: Eccentric Artist

attributes.content: When I started to assimilate, I became numb. I couldn't create or appreciate.
attributes.name: Eccentric Artist

attributes.content: You don't know how I felt when I realized that my brush was covered in dust... the pain I felt in that moment told me I had to leave the many.
attributes.name: Eccentric Artist

attributes.content: So you could not let go of human desire.
attributes.name: Priest

attributes.content: Humanity created art as a form of self-expression. Humanity admires art to seek the ego within.
attributes.name: Priest

attributes.content: Humanity is looking into a mirror, as humanity always has.
attributes.name: Priest

attributes.content: It's selfish, and pathetic...
attributes.name: Priest

attributes.content: (Puts down the brush)
attributes.name: Eccentric Artist

attributes.content: You've finished.
attributes.name: Priest

attributes.content: Yes, I have.
attributes.name: Eccentric Artist

attributes.content: Blue. As far as the eye can see. You've seen the depths of the ocean, and you understand that the confines of the canvas are too small for the great waves.
attributes.name: Priest

attributes.content: You saw the sea... but what I painted was a puddle.
attributes.name: Eccentric Artist

attributes.content: The destiny of water began in the ocean, and in the ocean it shall end.
attributes.name: Priest

attributes.content: That's the destiny of water, not the ocean.
attributes.name: Eccentric Artist

attributes.content: You have put your last stroke on the canvas. It's time to go.
attributes.name: Priest

attributes.content: I spent months without sleep in order to finish it. You came at just the right time. Maybe you should take another look, as the first being to lay eyes on it.
attributes.name: Eccentric Artist

attributes.content: To us, it's a piece of cloth with color on it. It has no meaning.
attributes.name: Priest

attributes.content: Cloth? No, you're wrong. You used to say that I couldn't see true greatness because I was fixated on the canvas. What about you, then?
attributes.name: Eccentric Artist

attributes.content: What?
attributes.name: Priest

attributes.content: Every surface in the room begins to peel away, revealing an eerie hue of blue beneath.
The blue begins to devour other colors around it, as though alive.
It soon takes over the entire house, even the cracks between the planks on the window, blocking out the sun completely.
The room should have turned pitch-black, but instead it is blue as far as the eye can see.
An ominous blue, a sinister blue.
Ah... so this is the big picture. Literally.
attributes.name: Priest

attributes.content: I have far underestimated the progress that you've made in the past six months.
attributes.name: Priest

attributes.content: Go home, Father. You never saw me. You missed your chance to catch me.
attributes.name: Eccentric Artist

attributes.content: What a shame...
attributes.name: Priest

attributes.content: You shouldn't have asked so many questions. Hunting and feeding don't need words.
attributes.name: Eccentric Artist

attributes.content: You shouldn't have come looking for me on your own.
attributes.name: Eccentric Artist

attributes.content: I see...
attributes.name: Priest

attributes.content: What is it?
attributes.name: Eccentric Artist

attributes.content: Over the past few years, I have been troubled by my failure to reach the next stage of metamorphosis. I've been trying to find out why.
attributes.name: Priest

attributes.content: After thinking on it, I still have a human desire: curiosity. That's why I wasn't able to metamorphose any further.
attributes.name: Priest

attributes.content: Looks like you stopped at the same place. A part of the human is always there with you, and you can't put it down, no matter how much you want to.
attributes.name: Eccentric Artist

attributes.content: Ah... what a shame.
attributes.name: Priest

attributes.content: Leave, Father. You won't become one of them, just like I couldn't. Run away, like I did.
attributes.name: Eccentric Artist

attributes.content: *Hiss*—Not giving up?
attributes.name: Eccentric Artist

attributes.content: You won't cut any deeper than a flesh wound.
attributes.name: Eccentric Artist

attributes.content: ...Damn.
attributes.name: Eccentric Artist

attributes.content: What did you put on me?
attributes.name: Eccentric Artist

attributes.content: Just a little mark.
attributes.name: Priest

attributes.content: You're far too powerful for me to purge on my own, but there will be kin who can. The mark will guide the way for them, and it will continue to beckon as long as you still draw breath.
attributes.name: Priest

attributes.content: I gave you a chance, Father.
attributes.name: Eccentric Artist

attributes.content: You chose to run away. You should be prepared to run forever.
attributes.name: Priest

attributes.content: I've reached a dead end. There's no way forward for me. I shall remain on the path forever.
attributes.name: Priest

attributes.content: My carcass will nourish those who come after me, who will go further.
attributes.name: Priest

attributes.content: I respect your choice.
attributes.name: Eccentric Artist

attributes.content: To the visitor's eyes, the blue around him begins to warp, struggling to break free.
Large lumps of slime fall to the ground and wriggle their way towards the visitor, crawling up his robes and leaving behind a wet trail.
They surround him tightly, the slime congealing into threads, then tentacles that bury him.
The last thing he sees as his vision fades away is the pitying gaze of a woman.
You think we're on the same path. But actually, our paths have only momentarily intersected.
attributes.name: Eccentric Artist

attributes.content: You thought I ran away, but actually, I've just reached a crossroads.
attributes.name: Eccentric Artist

attributes.content: The road keeps on going.
attributes.name: Eccentric Artist

attributes.content: Goodbye.
attributes.name: Eccentric Artist

attributes.content: Looks like I can't stay here anymore.
attributes.name: Eccentric Artist

attributes.content: Where could I work undisturbed?
attributes.name: Eccentric Artist

attributes.content: What was that sound?
attributes.name: Worried Townsfolk

attributes.content: You heard it too? I came to see what's going on.
attributes.name: Bold Townsfolk

attributes.content: Hey, is that a pile of rubble where the painter's house was?
attributes.name: Worried Townsfolk

attributes.content: Why would it collapse, all of a sudden?
attributes.name: Worried Townsfolk

attributes.content: I didn't see her outside today... she might be buried under all that.
attributes.name: Worried Townsfolk

attributes.content: Go get help!
attributes.name: Bold Townsfolk

attributes.content: Right.
attributes.name: Worried Townsfolk

attributes.content: Painter! Are you down there? Can you hear me?
attributes.name: Bold Townsfolk

attributes.content: What's going on? I came as soon as I heard. Why did the house collapse like that?
attributes.name: Art Shop Owner

attributes.content: Where's the painter? And that visitor who wanted his painting restored?
attributes.name: Art Shop Owner

attributes.content: If you've got time to ask questions, you've got time to dig!
attributes.name: Bold Townsfolk

attributes.content: I brought help!
attributes.name: Worried Townsfolk

attributes.content: Did you see anything?
attributes.name: Bold Townsfolk

attributes.content: No. What about you?
attributes.name: Worried Townsfolk

attributes.content: (Shake heads in unison)
attributes.name: Other Townsfolk

attributes.content: Nothing, not even a body.
attributes.name: Art Shop Owner

attributes.content: Did they leave?
attributes.name: Art Shop Owner

attributes.content: We went around the town on our way here. No one saw the painter.
attributes.name: Worried Townsfolk

attributes.content: Hey, what's this?
attributes.name: Art Shop Owner

attributes.content: A painting?
attributes.name: Worried Townsfolk

attributes.content: It's totally unharmed after being buried under rubble for so long?
attributes.name: Bold Townsfolk

attributes.content: What's the painting of? I can't tell.
attributes.name: Worried Townsfolk

attributes.content: All we can see is a corner, and it's all blue. Is it the sky? Or the...
attributes.name: Art Shop Owner

attributes.content: Shh...
attributes.name: Worried Townsfolk

attributes.content: We'll know once we dig it out.
attributes.name: Bold Townsfolk

attributes.content: Whoa—!
attributes.name: Bold Townsfolk

attributes.content: What is it?
attributes.name: Worried Townsfolk

attributes.content: What the heck is this?!
attributes.name: Bold Townsfolk

attributes.content: A ball of slime clings to his palm, shimmering under the sun, and leaving sticky threads as he tries to pull his hand free of the canvas.
